instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A PPbus  G3h Short To Ground
threads.message: Hey Guys working on this 15in <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on has green light on charger, has a short to ground on ppbus G3h circut So i removed fuses 7040 and 7041 put meter in diode mode short shows up on pin2 going to system. Then i injected voltage and nothing really gets hot but i used a flair inferred and only saw <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> getting warm so i removed chip from board, tested for short and short was gone I replaced <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> chip tested for short again and it was back any ideas on what component is causing this short?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A PPbus  G3h Short To Ground
threads.message: <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> was shorted so the CPU is already dead. When a FET is shorted you always replace the controller too so <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>. But as I said the CPU will 99% certain not have survived this.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A PPbus  G3h Short To Ground
threads.message: Copy that Duke i will remember this advice for next time any ideas what could have shorted this out there was no water damage.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A PPbus  G3h Short To Ground
threads.message: Could be anything, usually liquid or idiot damage.
